Identification.ShortTitle: Canadian Egg Pricing (Interprovincial and Export) Regulations
Identification.LongTitle: Regulations Respecting the Pricing and Marketing in the Interprovincial and Export Trade of Eggs Produced in Canada

Section.Text: These Regulations may be cited as the Canadian Egg Pricing (Interprovincial and Export) Regulations.

Definition.Text: Agency means the Canadian Egg Marketing Agency; (Office)
egg means egg of a hen; (oeuf)
hen means a hen of any class of the domestic chicken belonging to the species Gallus Domesticus. (poule)

Section.Text: These Regulations apply only to the marketing of eggs in interprovincial and export trade.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell or offer to sell eggs at less than the minimum price from time to time determined by the Agency.
No person shall buy eggs at less than the minimum price from time to time determined by the Agency.
